units.title: Colon tissue preparation and washing
units.text: For organoid generation, colon tissue was first sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientific) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish filled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 10 mM HEPES (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X GlutaMAX (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X Pen-Strep (Thermo Fisher Scientific), and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B (Thermo Fisher Scientific)).
units.rationale: Provides the initial dissection and cleaning steps needed to obtain colon tissue for organoid culture.

units.title: Mincing and washing of epithelium
units.text: and then minced from tissue segments using scalpels (Fisher Scientific) and collected into 50 mL conical tubes. Minced epithelium was washed 3 times with DMEM++ (Advanced DMEM/F12 (Thermo Fisher Scientific) supplemented with 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X Pen-Strep, and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B), and centrifuged at 4 °C, 500 × g for 3 min.
units.rationale: Describes how to fragment the tissue and remove debris before crypt isolation.

units.title: EDTA digestion for crypt isolation
units.text: The tissue was then resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end-over-end rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12 min.
units.rationale: Isolates intestinal crypts by chelating calcium with EDTA.

units.title: Plating crypts in microwell plates with Matrigel
units.text: crypts were placed into the microwell plates at a density of 200 cells per microwell, in 50 µL of media per well. The plates were placed in the incubator for 30–60 min to allow the cells to settle, after which another 100 µL of media containing 2% Matrigel was added per well.
units.rationale: Establishes the seeding density and matrix support for organoid formation.

units.title: Organoid growth media formulation
units.text: Organoid growth media65: Advanced DMEM/F12 supplemented with 1X Pen-Strep, 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X B-27 Supplement, 0.2 nM Wnt Surrogate protein, 5 nM Gastrin-1, 1.25mM N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine, 10 mM Nicotinamide, 100 µg/mL Primocin, 500 nM A 83-01, 50 ng/mL recombinant human EGF, 100 ng/mL recombinant human Noggin, 250 ng/mL recombinant human R-spondin 3, 100 ng/mL recombinant human IGF1, 50 ng/mL recombinant human FGF2, and 10 µM Y-27632.
units.rationale: Lists the complete set of supplements required to sustain organoid growth.

units.title: Irradiation injury protocol
units.text: For irradiation studies, the plates were placed on the center of the rotating table of the (137Cs) gamma irradiator) for the time periods equivalent to either 6 Gy or 12 Gy, and then the organoids were further cultured in the incubator.
units.rationale: Specifies the dose and handling of gamma irradiation to model injury.

units.title: DSS treatment protocol
units.text: For DSS treatment, DSS (MP Biomedicals) was dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media. The low and high doses considered were 0.1% DSS and 0.5% (wt/vol) DSS in organoid media.
units.rationale: Describes how to apply dextran sulfate sodium to induce inflammatory injury.

units.title: Cytomix injury protocol
units.text: For cytomix treatment, human recombinant TNFɑ (R&D Systems), IFNɣ (R&D systems), and IL-1β (PeproTech) were dissolved in organoid media. Organoids were cultured every 5–7 days as needed based on size and morphology.
units.rationale: Outlines the cytokine cocktail used to simulate inflammatory signaling.

units.title: FITC‑dextran permeability assay
units.text: FITC-Dextran (MedChemExpress) diluted to 2 mg/mL in PBS for 5 min in the incubator (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 30 min, after which organoid growth media with 10 µM Y-27632 was added.
units.rationale: Provides a method to assess barrier integrity of organoids.

units.title: Caspase‑3/7 apoptosis detection assay
units.text: Organoids were incubated in CellEvent Caspase-3/7 Detection Reagent (Thermo Fisher) diluted in media according to manufacturer protocols for 30 min, washed with PBS, and imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect fluorescence and DIC images.
units.rationale: Details the procedure for quantifying apoptosis in treated organoids.
